page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT NETT'M RSNC H.Q.
page.content: The quiet but busy national H.Q.of the royal society for nature conservation & its childrens branch WATCH are in the former INST.,THE GREEN,NETTLEHAM.15 full & 2 part timers work in the offices & warehouses,extra staff being employed at busy times.There is computer control of sales & club membership.The RSNC advises & assists 46 trusts,with over 1,500 reserves,& 160,000 members to whom"natural world" is sent 3 times annually.Postage rises from Â£100pw_ Â£2,500 when Watchword is dispatched. Since watch began in 1971 its members have surveyed fresh water air&beach pollution,flower rich verges,noise nuisance,& tree damage.In 1979 came Frogwatch,with nationwide frogspawn sightings.Records were made of rain & snow acidity in Jan/Feb 1985,results being reported on radio and t.v..
